Package controller

Class Reports

java.lang.Object
controller.Reports
public class Reports extends Object
Controls the Reports view, managing the display and inputs for various report types.

  • Constructor Details

    • Reports

      public Reports()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the Reports view. This method sets the current user's name, prepares the reports list, and sets up the table view columns and event listeners. It also checks for any upcoming appointments and displays any necessary alerts.

      LAMBDA: The lambda used within Platform.runLater is for delaying the upcoming appointments alert. Without runLater, the alert was executing at the login screen before the scene fully transitioned. I could have implemented it with an anonymous inner class instead but since the logic was simple here and I only need to use it in one place, a lambda expression felt appropriate.

    • setupReportList

      private void setupReportList()
      Sets up the list of reports with predefined report types and descriptions.

    • setupReportTableColumns

      private void setupReportTableColumns()
      Sets up the columns for the reports table view and sets the list of reports as its items.

    • setupEventListeners

      private void setupEventListeners()
      Manages the visibility, editable state, and prompt text of textFieldReportInput1. This input becomes part of a db query for the report that is to be run.

      LAMBDA: Used to update the visibility, edit ability, and prompt text of textFieldReportInput1. Lambda approach used for brevity.

    • onCustomerTabButtonClick

      public void onCustomerTabButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Switches the current scene to the Customer view when the Customer navigation tab is clicked.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - A click event on the Customer Navigation Tab.

    • onAppointmentsTabButtonClick

      public void onAppointmentsTabButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Switches the current scene to the Appointments view when the Appointments navigation tab is clicked.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - A click event on the Appointments Navigation Tab.

    • onViewReportButtonClick

      public void onViewReportButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Validates report input field before displaying the selected report. Alert is shown if validation fails. Otherwise, the report results are set up for viewing.

    • validateReportInput

      private boolean validateReportInput()
      This method ensures that the input field has some text entered into it.
      Returns:
      True if the input is not empty, false otherwise.

    • showEmptyFieldAlert

      private void showEmptyFieldAlert()
      Displays an alert indicating that a required field needed in order for the report to run is empty.

    • onLogoutButtonClick

      public void onLogoutButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the event for logout button clicks. Logs out the current user by calling the UserLogin.userLogout method.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - A click event on the logout button.

    • setupReportResultsTableView

      private void setupReportResultsTableView(Report selectedReport)
      Based on the selected report for viewing, configures the table view to show the appropriate result.
      Parameters:
      selectedReport - The report selected for viewing

    • displayUpcomingAppointments

      private void displayUpcomingAppointments()
      Displays appointments within the next 15 minutes for the current user. Sets the UI message based on the number of upcoming appointments.

    • displayAggregateReportByTypeAndMonth

      private void displayAggregateReportByTypeAndMonth()
      Displays an aggregate report for the number of appointments by type and month.

    • displayAppointmentsForInput

      private void displayAppointmentsForInput(int reportId)
      Displays the appropriate appointments-based report based on the report ID, either for appointments by contact ID or for appointments by customer ID.

    • setupAppointmentTableViewColumns

      private void setupAppointmentTableViewColumns()
      Sets up the columns for the appointments table view with mappings to the Appointment class attributes.

    • setupAggregateReportByTypeAndMonthColumns

      private void setupAggregateReportByTypeAndMonthColumns()
      Initializes and configures columns for the aggregate report by type and month based on mapped data values.

      LAMBDA: Used for linking the table column data with the model. Lambda approach is direct, clear, and easy to read.

    • setupAggregateReportByContactAndQuarterColumns

      private void setupAggregateReportByContactAndQuarterColumns()
      Initializes and configures columns for the aggregate report by contact and quarter based on mapped data values.

      LAMBDA: Used for linking the table column data with the model. Lambda approach is direct, clear, and easy to read.

    • displayAggregateReportByContactAndQuarter

      private void displayAggregateReportByContactAndQuarter()
      Displays an aggregate report for the number of appointments by contact and quarter.

    • setUpcomingAppointmentsForCurrentUser

      private void setUpcomingAppointmentsForCurrentUser()
      Checks on the number of upcoming appointments for the current active user.

    • showUpcomingAppointmentsAlert

      private void showUpcomingAppointmentsAlert()
      Alerts the user of the number of upcoming appointments within the next 15 minutes.

    • resetTextActionResultMessage

      private void resetTextActionResultMessage()
      Clears the display message, which currently displays information about upcoming appointments.
